bioghist.p: George Herbert Needham was a microscopist. He served as President of the New York Microscopical Society and was the author of The practical use of the microscope, including photomicrography, published in 1958, and other publications.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two albums of selected photomicrographs, portraits, newspaper and magazine clippings, possibly collected and assembled by George Needham. The albums contain images of diatoms, insects, blood cells, minerals, snow crystals, as well as several photographs of H. C. Wheeler and possibly George Needham.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
